content: I'm a Ph.D. candidate and DOE CSGF fellow, advised by Peter Dinda at Northwestern University. My research interests mainly lie in operating system and compiler support for parallel computing. In my free time, I enjoy running and multiplayer game development. Publications # Optimizing PyTorch Inference with LLM-Based Multi-Agent Systems Kirill Nagaitsev, Luka Grbcic, Samuel Williams, Costin Iancu 2025-11-21 Preprint Eliminating Hardware Interrupts with Dispersed Interrupt Polling Kirill Nagaitsev, Kevin McAfee, Kevin Hayes, Justin Dong, Nadharm Dhiantravan, Peter Dinda 2025-09 Tech Report Village: From High Level Parallelism to High Performance Kirill Nagaitsev, Griffin Dube, Karl Hallsby, Peizhi Liu, Qinze Jiang, Lucas Myers, David Krasowska, Alexander Butler, Ruiqi Xu, Peter Dinda 2025-08 Tech Report funcX: Federated Function as a Service for Science Zhuozhao Li, Ryan Chard, Yadu Babuji, Ben Galewsky, Tyler Skluzacek, Kirill Nagaitsev, Anna Woodard, Ben Blaiszik, Josh Bryan, Daniel S. Katz, Ian Foster, Kyle Chard 2022-09-22 IEEE TPDS
title: Kirill Nagaitsev
